DataElement.preferredName: Hematology Haptoglobin Level Laboratory Result Value in mg/dL
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof._Haptoglobin (406 aa, ~45 kDa) is encoded by the human HP gene. This protein plays a role in tight junction disassembly, intestinal permeability, heme iron recycling, antimicrobial activity and the regulation of hydrogen peroxide catabolism._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount._A laboratory result using the metric measure of milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof._Haptoglobin (406 aa, ~45 kDa) is encoded by the human HP gene. This protein plays a role in tight junction disassembly, intestinal permeability, heme iron recycling, antimicrobial activity and the regulation of hydrogen peroxide catabolism._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredDefinition: Haptoglobin (406 aa, ~45 kDa) is encoded by the human HP gene. This protein plays a role in tight junction disassembly, intestinal permeability, heme iron recycling, antimicrobial activity and the regulation of hydrogen peroxide catabolism.:A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

Concepts.definition: Haptoglobin (406 aa, ~45 kDa) is encoded by the human HP gene. This protein plays a role in tight junction disassembly, intestinal permeability, heme iron recycling, antimicrobial activity and the regulation of hydrogen peroxide catabolism.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A laboratory result using the metric measure of milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Laboratory; a workplace for the conduct of scientific research.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/20/13 unretired; VD reused outside FBPP content. jc  2/9/12 - Retired as part of content cleanup activities per concurrence with Jenny Larkin (NHLBI).
